intro: Merrilliopanax chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese merrilliopanax, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive fruiting structures. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within mountainous regions. Its botanical features include palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets and small, yellowish-green flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
